ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: In the next two weeks, how likely is it that you will: Drink alcohol and take opioid medications in the same day.
In the next two weeks, how likely is it that you will: Drink alcohol and take opioid medications within two hours of each other.
In the next two weeks, how likely is it that you will: Drink alcohol and take opioid medications close enough together where you feel the effects of both at the same time.
(For females) In the next TWO WEEKS, how likely is it that you will have 4 OR MORE DRINKS IN ONE SITTING: On the same day you take opioid medications.
(For females) In the next TWO WEEKS, how likely is it that you will have 4 OR MORE DRINKS IN ONE SITTING: Within two hours of taking opioid medications.

(For females) In the next TWO WEEKS, how likely is it that you will have 4 OR MORE DRINKS IN ONE SITTING: Close enough in time to taking your opioid medications where you can feel the effects of both substances at once.
(For males) In the next TWO WEEKS, how likely is it that you will have 5 OR MORE DRINKS IN ONE SITTING: On the same day you take opioid medications.
(For males) In the next TWO WEEKS, how likely is it that you will have 5 OR MORE DRINKS IN ONE SITTING: Within two hours of taking opioid medications.

(For males) In the next TWO WEEKS, how likely is it that you will have 5 OR MORE DRINKS IN ONE SITTING: Close enough in time to taking your opioid medications where you can feel the effects of both substances at once.
Behavioral Expectations to Co-Use Alcohol and Opioids Score
